homes_hear_details: Alabama has not yet launched its HOMES or HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Alabama Department of Economic and Community Affairs (ADECA) is the designated administrator and is in the planning and application phase with the U.S. Department of Energy.
state_energy_office: Alabama Department of Economic and Community Affairs (ADECA)

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Alabama, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. For example, in Jefferson County (Birmingham), 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $55,300. Rural counties may be significantly lower.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Alabama, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Jefferson County (Birmingham), 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $103,700.

net_metering: Alabama does not have a statewide net metering policy. Alabama Power offers a rate-based program called Rate Rider RCG for small renewable generators (up to 25 kW) that credits customers at the avoided cost rate, which is significantly below the retail rate.

state_rebate_programs.name: TVA EnergyRight Residential Services
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) and local power companies
state_rebate_programs.amount: Varies by measure; up to $1,500 for qualifying heat pumps
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, insulation, air sealing, duct sealing, ENERGY STAR appliances
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to customers of TVA-served utilities in northern Alabama including Huntsville Utilities, Decatur Utilities, and others. Includes home energy evaluations and rebates for qualifying improvements.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Alabama Department of Economic and Community Affairs (ADECA)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,669 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating/cooling system repair or replacement, window and door improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through local community action agencies.

programs.name: Residential Energy Checkup
programs.eligible_items: Home energy audit identifying efficiency improvement opportunities

programs.name: Appliance Rebate Program
programs.eligible_items: ENERGY STAR certified heat pumps, water heaters, smart thermostats

programs.name: TVA EnergyRight Heat Pump Rebate
programs.amount: Up to $1,500 for qualifying heat pumps
programs.eligible_items: ENERGY STAR certified heat pumps meeting minimum efficiency requirements
